title: Business Live: FTSE 100 and US stocks fall - BBC News
summary: lse chairman faces call to quit .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for this evening .
thanks very much for reading , and i hope you can join us again tomorrow when the business live coverage will restart at 06:00 uk time .
for coverage of the disney results , check the business page of the bbc news website .

documents.title: equifax
text: beleaguered credit rating firm equifax has reported a fall in profits , as the firm counts the cost of a major data loss affecting more than 145 million customers .
the firm 's net income fell 27 % to $ 96m , after it recorded a $ 27m cost related to the cybersecurity incident .
elsewhere on wall street , news corp is yet to report its quarterly results ( see post at 20:46 ) .

documents.title: disney suffers box office blues
text: walt disney has reported a 2.8 % drop in quarterly revenue , weighed down by the lack of any major box office releases .
disney 's revenue fell to $ 12.8bn in the quarter ended 30 september from $ 13.1bn a year earlier - with major titles , like star wars : the last jedi , not out until next month .
the firm did n't address a media report that it has held talks about acquiring most of 21st century fox 's film and television assets .
analysts might ask for a response on the results call later this evening - but that will come after the business live page has closed .

documents.title: wall street finishes lower
text: all three major us stock indexes have ended in negative territory - although they pared some of the losses seen earlier in the day .
the dow jones index , which was down more than 200 points halfway through the session , finished the day with a loss of 101 points , or 0.4 % , at 23,462 .
the wider s & p 500 fell 0.4 % to 2,585 , and the tech-heavy nasdaq dropped 0.6 % to 6,750 .
analysts putting the volatility down to uncertainty about republican tax-cutting plans , along with falls for apple and other tech stocks .

documents.title: the murdoch empire
text: 21st century fox might be on investors ' minds this evening when disney 's results come out , after the reports that the two businesses have recently held talks .
but we 'll also be getting results from another rupert murdoch firm , news corp , after the closing bell in new york .
if you 're wondering how murdoch 's wide sweep of businesses all fits together , we 've put together this handy diagram .

documents.title: a disney takeover of fox ?
text: in about 30 minutes we 'll have the latest disney results , and maybe some comment on reports it 's been in talks with 21st century fox .

earlier this week , cnbc reported that disney had , in the last few weeks , held discussions with rupert murdoch 's firm about buying assets including fox 's movie studio and its 39 % stake in british broadcaster sky .
fox 's chairman lachlan murdoch declined to answer questions about the media reports yesterday , but did say `` we like where we are '' on the brands fox has .

documents.title: watch : spacey to be erased from new film
text: in case you missed this earlier , us actor kevin spacey is to be edited out of a completed hollywood film .
the studio and director took the unprecedented step following allegations of predatory sexual behaviour against spacey .
his role in `` all the money in the world '' will be recast and the scenes reshot , but distributor sony pictures still plans to release the film next month as planned .

documents.title: at & t 'ready to litigate ' over time warner deal
text: as deals go , it does n't get much bigger than us telecoms giant at & t 's $ 85bn takeover of tv and media firm time warner .
it 's probably no surprise then that at & t chief executive , randall stephenson , has said the company is ready to launch a legal challenge if the deal is n't given regulatory approval .
`` if we are going to go for litigation our preference would be sooner is better .
we are prepared to litigate now , '' mr stephenson told cnbc .
the trump administration is reportedly pushing for the sale of assets such as news network cnn before it would approve the merger .

documents.title: lewis hamilton brushes off paradise papers question
text: british racing driver lewis hamilton would n't be drawn on a question about his tax affairs after being named this week in the paradise papers leak .
hamilton avoided vat on his £ 16.5m luxury jet by importing it to the isle of man , the documents show .
his lawyers said a tax barrister review found the structure was lawful .

speaking ahead of the brazilian grand prix - his first race since winning the formula 1 title for the fourth time last month - hamilton said he did n't have anything to add to the statement released this week by his team .
his focus instead has been on a break in the caribbean and peru , where he visited the ancient inca site of machu picchu .
`` i 've come off with a huge amount of positivity from that week , '' he said .

documents.title: uber expects to float in 2019
text: app-based taxi service uber is still fighting to get its licence restored in london , but in its native us , it 's pushing ahead .
speaking in new york , chief executive dara khosrowshahi said the firm was on track for a flotation in 2019 and the plan was not dependent on new funding from japan 's softbank .
at the moment , he said , `` we have all the disadvantages of being a public company as far as the spotlight on us without any of the advantages of being a public company . ''

documents.title: lse confirms it received activist 's letter
text: the public battle at the london stock exchange stepped up a notch this evening , when an activist investor called for a vote to oust the chairman of the uk 's stock exchange operator .
a spokesman for the london stock exchange group has acknowledged receipt of the letter from activist hedge fund tci , but declined to comment further .
tci , founded by billionaire sir chris hohn , used its holding in the company to call for a meeting to remove lse chairman donald brydon over claims he pushed out chief executive xavier rolet .
a date for the meeting is yet to be set .

documents.title: wall street still heading lower
text: wall street 's main indexes opened lower a while ago , but now the downward trend has firmly set in .
the dow jones is currently down 150.29 points or 0.64 % at 23,413.07 , while the s & p 500 has fallen 15.88 points or 0.61 % to 2,578.50 .
the biggest loser in percentage terms is the tech-heavy nasdaq , which has shed 69.40 points or 1.02 % and is now at 6,719.71 .
one bright spot on the scene is the retail sector .
department stores have been suffering of late , feeling the heat from online competition , but macy 's is up 11 % at the moment , while jc penney has made gains of 7.6 % .

documents.title: amazon makes soccer play
text: us tech giant amazon has pushed further into sports rights through a deal with english premier league club manchester city .
amazon prime video will launch a behind-the-scenes , multi-part series that follows the football club through the current season .
city - which are owned by abu dhabi royalty - finished third last season , but are currently top of the premier league by eight points .
in april , amazon won the rights to stream 10 nfl games this year .
the company has also been rumoured as a possible bidder in the next round of premier league broadcasting rights .

documents.title: gordon brown expects 'brexit crisis point '
text: former pm gordon brown has told @ twitterid he expects a brexit `` crisis point '' next summer .
see the whole interview later on @ twitterid

documents.title: lse chairman faces call to quit
text: this is the key demand from activist investor sir chris hohn at a special meeting he 's requested of london stock exchange shareholders .

documents.title: activist looks to shake up lse top team
text: london stock exchange chairman donald brydon ( centre left ) is accused of `` failing to provide shareholders '' with a reason for the removal of the company 's chief executive , in a letter by activist hedge fund investor tci .

tci , founded by billionaire sir chris hohn , has called for a formal meeting of shareholders to vote on whether to remove mr brydon , who he accuses of `` hiding behind confidentiality agreements '' .
sir chris said tci also wants the company to terminate its search for a new chief executive and , if current boss xavier rolet ( left ) accepts , extend his tenure until 2021 .
tci holds just over a 5 % stake in lse , enough for it to be able to call such a meeting .

documents.title: turbulent times at the lse
text: the business pages have been full of reports this week about the london stock exchange and the departure of its high-flying chief executive , xavier rolet .

one of the company 's biggest investors - hedge fund billionaire sir chris hohn - has suggested mr rolet was shown the door by lse chairman donald brydon , and has called for answers about why he 's leaving .
mr rolet 's stock is high among investors , despite his failed merger with the german stock exchange earlier this year .
under mr rolet 's leadership , the group 's market capitalisation has surged from £ 800m when he joined in may 2009 to almost £ 14bn today .
sir chris 's firm , the children 's investment fund , has now requested an emergency meeting to discuss mr rolet 's departure , and vote on the removal of chairman donald brydon .

documents.title: twitter 's 'blue tick ' broken
text: it 's a badge of honour for many twitterati .
but now the system of `` blue ticks '' - like the one seen next to twitter founder jack dorsey , above - has been suspended .
the social network has described the system , which is used to verify profiles , as `` broken '' , following complaints over the type of accounts being approved .
ty prominent people get a blue tick on their profile after proving their identity , but some far-right and white-supremacist accounts have now also been verified .
twitter founder jack dorsey said in the tweet below that the scheme would now be `` reconsidered '' .

we should 've communicated faster on this ( yesterday ) : our agents have been following our verification policy correctly , but we realized some time ago the system is broken and needs to be reconsidered .
and we failed by not doing anything about it .
working now to fix faster .
why not verify me instead @ twitterid
i am interested to know where you are in the process .
i am an author , and i have links to my work and where/how to purchase .
verification would ostensibly help in name/brand recognition .
thanks in advance .
no shit !
look what you created with bellamar !
jack dorsey / purple heart
i 'm an artist , i draw , and make # svencoop levels for 18 years .

i 'm usually left-wing but last year i voted trump ( probly a mistake but # yolo ) and got # redpilled i hope that twitter will unpause/fix verifications & see us all as human & i hope to get a # bluecheckmark oneday
verify what ?

interesting that you do nothing about those things but so worried about a blue check and that those two groups dont get their feelings hurt .
so you are the thought police .
thank you , because we 've been waiting for the process to run smoothly
lol hold up
happy birthday

how can you explain that ?
its a class system .

who do you think you are ?
james bond ?

documents.title: 'acute retail headache '
text: the ftse 100 fell 0.6 % to below 7,500 points , as it was dragged lower by burberry 's `` eye-watering 10 % decline '' , says spreadex analyst connor campbell .
elsewhere in retail , sainsbury 's fell 2 % .
there was pain as well for mining stocks - which make up a big chunk of trading on the ftse 100 - with rio tinto , bhp billiton and anglo american all seeing falls .

`` an acute retail headache , and a red-soaked set of mining stocks , meant the ftse failed to take advantage of the pound 's losses against the euro ( and flat performance against the dollar ) , '' mr campbell says .

documents.title: ftse stumbles
text: it 's been a bumpy day on the uk 's 100 share index .
the ftse 100 has finished 46 points , or 0.6 % , lower at 7,484 points amid falls for housebuilders and retailers .

documents.title: disappearing snap
text: hopes that shares in the owner of snapchat would recover today seem to be disappearing as quickly as one of the app 's messages .
they are down a further 4 % , after analysts at morgan stanley downgraded the stock to `` underweight '' .
snap saw its share price tumble by as much as 20 % on wednesday after it posted disappointing ad revenues , as well as a $ 40m ( £ 30m ) hit from its video-recording sunglasses .
the company 's shares are currently priced at $ 12.40 , down 27 % from its flotation price of $ 17 when it listed on wall street in march .

documents.title: 'leave lebanon , ' saudi arabia tells citizens
text: saudi arabia has advised its citizens against travelling to lebanon and asked those in the country to leave as soon as possible , the kingdom 's official news agency reported .

lebanese prime minister saad al-hariri ( resigned on saturday while in saudi arabia , accusing iran and the lebanese shi'ite group hezbollah of seeking strife in arab states and saying he feared assassination .
two top lebanese government officials accused riyadh of holding mr al-hariri a captive .
a third told the reuters news agency that the saudi authorities ordered mr al-hariri to resign and put him under house arrest .

documents.title: sellafield strike
text: workers at the sellafield nuclear reprocessing plant are to go on a fresh strike in a dispute over pay .
members of the unite union will walk out on 22 november 22 in protest at an imposed 1.5 % wage increase .
this follows a strike on tuesday which saw over 1,000 workers walk out after management was accused of `` going cold '' on attempts to reach a pay deal .
the workers claim the `` derisory pay deal '' is far behind the rising rate of inflation .
`` the safety and security of the sellafield site are our priorities during any industrial action , '' said a spokesperson for sellafield .

documents.title: pork crackling advent calendar anyone ?
text: there 's a vast new range of advent calendars aimed at adults .
would you buy one full of gin or pork crackling ?
# wakeuptomoney
amazing variety this year did loads of interviews about this last year my fave @ twitterid wine calendar

documents.title: hold the phone
text: sticking with the us , and growth at one of the country 's biggest networks , t-mobile , has boosted telecoms firm deutsche telekom .
deutsche reported strong revenue growth at t-mobile , despite rumours of a failed merger bid between the us network and rival sprint .
the group said adjusted operating profits rose by 3.3 % to €5.7bn ( £ 5bn ) between july and september , on the back of revenues up 0.8 % to €18.3bn compared with same period a year earlier .

documents.title: wall street retreats
text: a quick look at the markets in new york , and the major us stock indices have fallen from record highs at the start of trading .
the dow jones is down 0.3 % at 23,488 points , while the wider s & p 500 is down 0.4 % at 2,583 points and the tech-heavy nasdaq is 0.6 % lower at 6,747 .
analysts pointed to uncertainty over the fate of president trump 's tax overhaul making its way through congress .

documents.title: making a splash
text: political editor laura kuenssberg gives a quick summary of penny mordaunt , the new international development secretary
the reality tv laura 's referring to was itv 's diving show , splash .

the portsmouth conservative mp exited the contest in january 2014 after twice mistiming her back somersault from the 7.5m board but earned praise from tom daley and the other judges for her have-a-go attitude .
you can find out more about the new cabinet minister , here .
so mordaunt - promotion from dwp , brexiteer , former aid worker , and not opposed to a bit of reality tv
no mention of turkey ?
# rewardingliars

chicken and salad wraps

we now live in a world where the leader can be in charge of everything but responsible for nothing # exemploducemus
promoted from a very small pool of talent .
this government is governing '' under false pretences should n't last another day
and liar !
tory minister penny mordaunt 'plain and simple lying ' over turkey joining eu '' .
a turkey voting for christmas , well i never
the govt is in a shambolic state , rudderless and until they bring an end to their infighting they 'll never be able to get the best deal on brexit
impossible because there is no best deal only a worse deal .
i fully agree with you .
i was shocked when we had the result to leave the eu .
people fell for the crap being peddled by the leave campaign .
but we need the best deal possible

seems to me you do n't know what that means !
revolution seems to be getting nearer .

documents.title: breakingmay announces cabinet replacement
text: theresa may has appointed penny mordaunt as the new international development secretary .
the prime minister was forced to make the cabinet appointment after priti patel left the role last night amid a controversy over her meetings with israeli politicians .
the political uncertainty around mrs may 's cabinet unsettled the pound yesterday , dragging it down 0.5 % against the dollar and euro .

documents.title: bank 's uk forecasts
text: so how do those eu forecasts of slower uk growth - at 1.5 % this year and 1.3 % in 2018 - compare with other estimates ?

we 'll get the official uk forecasts in the budget on 22 november , while the bank of england updated its own forecasts last week - although it was widely overlooked because attention was on the bank 's decision to raise interest rates for the first time in a decade .
tucked inside the bank 's quarterly inflation report , it predicted the uk economy would grow at 1.6 % this year and next year , before edging up slightly in 2019 .

documents.title: bottom of the table
text: a bit more on the eu 's latest economic forecasts , which predict that uk growth will drop to its lowest level in a decade in 2019 , the year britain is due to leave the bloc .
the latest forecast from the european commission also shows the uk economy will grow by 1.5 % this year and 1.3 % in 2018 .
that would point it joint last , with italy , among europe 's biggest economies .
the uk is also forecast to be bottom of the list for investment growth in the next two years , dropping to 0.7 % in 2018 .

documents.title: good afternoon
text: thanks chris and zahra for taking us through the morning .
coming up later on , we 've got results out from disney and rupert murdoch 's news corp .
disney was rumoured earlier this week to be interested in buying assets from another part of murdoch 's business empire , 21st century fox .
it 's also expected that disney 's results will show growth at its theme parks - like walt disney world resort , above .
i 'll be your tour guide for that and all the other breaking stories as they happen .
any feedback - good or bad - feel free to send it over to bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk .
author: Dan Macadam
BBC business reporter

documents.title: slower sales
text: sales at us retailer macy 's have seen a bigger-than-expected drop in the third quarter .
revenue at macy 's stores open for more than 12 months - including sales in departments licensed to third parties - were down 3.6 % , compared to an anticipated decline of 2.6 % .
total sales retreated 6.1 % to $ 5.3bn ( £ 4bn ) .

several us department stores including macy 's , sears , kohl 's , nordstrom and jc penney have been struggling with declining demand for apparel - the mainstay of department stores - due to tough competition from off-price retailers , as well as amazon.com .

documents.title: all the cheese
text: dairy crest said first-half profits surged more than nine fold as the british dairy company eliminated its pension deficit and benefited from cheese sales .
pre-tax profits for the six months to 30 september soared to £ 151m from £ 15.6m a year earlier .
the company said it changed the way it calculates pension payouts , linking its scheme to the consumer price index rather than the retail price index .
dairy crest owns the brands clover , frylight and cathedral city cheddar , whose volumes rose 10 % .

documents.title: brexit spooks independent restaurants
text: brexit and rising costs are denting london 's independent restaurant scene , a new report shows .
the harden 's dining guide reveals that the number of new independent restaurants in the capital dropped to 193 from 200 in the past year .
that compares with more new spin-off eateries in the period , with the figure jumping to 53 from 25 .
i can see no positives and only negatives in the impact of brexit , '' peter harden , co-founder of the guide , tells bloomberg news .
every chef you talk to is worried by increasing food costs and the difficulty in recruiting staff .
many refer to it as a crisis in the industry '' .

documents.title: not enough in the kitty
text: the economic squeeze really is taking its toll : fewer uk households now own a pet .
just 56 % now have one , down from 63 % five years ago , say retail analysts mintel .
the fall is partly blamed on the rise of renting from landlords who wo n't allow tenants to keep pets .
`` shrinking household sizes and the trend of consumers starting their families later in life are all having a negative effect on pet ownership , '' said emma clifford of mintel .
`` additionally , the shift towards privately rented accommodation continues to put downward pressure on pet ownership . ''
more here .

documents.title: taxing problems
text: capital economics tweets :
our head of consultancy has an article in @ twitterid today about # paradisepapers .
see our views on how this issue is diverting attention from the real problems with the global tax system :

documents.title: saudi aramco guarantees
text: the uk government will give saudi aramco $ 2bn in credit guarantees so the saudi oil giant can buy goods and services from britain more easily .
`` this builds on previous support for uk exports as part of saudi aramco joint venture projects , '' a government spokesperson said .
the financial times first reported the plan , which coincides with uk efforts to persuade the saudi state-owned company to list its shares on the london stock exchange .
a treasury spokesman said the credit guarantees were not part of the attempt to secure the ipo .

documents.title: vodafone 's fibre deal
text: bt 's openreach division could have a major comptetitor on its hards after vodafone announced a major partnership with cityfibre that will bring - you guessed it - fibre broadband to up to five million uk homes .
some one million homes and businesses in 12 towns and cities - which are yet to be named - will be connected to the new fibre network during the first phase , which will be finished by about 2021 .
the two companies will then have the right to extend their agreement to cover another four million sites across 50 towns and cities by 2025 .
shares in aim-listed cityfibre soared by a quarter , while vodafone added 1.6p to 217.5p .

documents.title: lloyds raises savers ' rates
text: news personal finance correspondent simon gompertz tweets :
lloyds says `` most of our savers will receive an increase of 0.15 % '' .
that 's after bank of england put up its base rate by 0.25 %
banks using rate increase to increase their own margins .
lloyds rate increases for savers include cash isa saver 0.2 % - > 0.35 % and rockbottom lloyds easy saver/halifax everyday saver 0.05 % - > 0.2 %
lloyds says it 's adding 0.15 % to savings rates - it said last week it would put the full 0.25 % on variable mortgage rates

documents.title: south korea emissions fines
text: south korea 's environment ministry said it will fine units of mercedes-benz , bmw and porsche a total of $ 63m ( £ 48m ) for violating emission rules .
bmw will face the largest penalty - 60.8 billion won ( $ 54m ) - with the car maker accused of forging emission test documents for more than 80,000 cars between 2012 and 2015 .

documents.title: savings boost
text: national savings and investments said it is raising rates on its variable rate products , including premium bonds , from 1 december .
ns & i will pass on the bank of england 's interest rate rise to savers , following its decision to increase rates to 0.5 % from 0.25 % , the first rise in a decade .

savers will be pleased so see so many providers are passing on the rate rise in full , for at least some of their accounts , and ns & i savers will be delighted to see it join the fray '' , said sarah coles , personal finance analyst at hargreaves lansdown .
the really exciting news for many people is that premium bonds are going to get more generous '' .

documents.title: wind comes out of vestas ' sails
text: think investors in burberry are having a bad day ?
spare a thought for vestas , the world 's largest wind turbine manufacturer , whose shares are down by an eyewatering 20 % in copenhagen today .
the company said net profit fell 18 % in the third quarter to €253m , while sales slid 5.5 % to €2.7bn .
vestas also cut its outlook for revenues and margins , which is what appears to have really spooked investors .
one of vestas 's main competitors , the newly merged turbine units of siemens and spain 's gamesa , said this week it would cut up to 6,000 jobs .

documents.title: uk 'slows markedly '
text: more on those eu growth projections , which conclude that uk growth has `` slowed markedly '' this year to an expected 1.5 % , down from 1.8 % in its spring forecast .
the figure puts britain 's economy joint lowest in the bloc with italy , and far below both the significantly upgraded eurozone forecast of 2.2 % growth for 2017 and the wider eu outlook of 2.3 % .
`` economic growth in the uk has been slowing since the start of the year , as higher consumer prices constrained private consumption growth , '' the eu forecast said .
`` based on a purely technical assumption of status quo in terms of trading relations between the eu27 and the uk , growth is still expected to remain subdued over the forecast horizon . ''

documents.title: breakingfastest eurozone growth for a decade
text: the eu has sharply raised its eurozone growth forecast , predicting it will expand by 2.2 % this year - its fastest pace in a decade .
the european commission figure is substantially higher than the previous forecast of 1.7 % and comes as the latest gdp growth figures beat expectations .
however , the commission slashed its uk outlook for 2017 to 1.5 % due to `` uncertainty '' over brexit , and cut the figure for next year to 1.3 % and just 1.1 % in 2019 .

documents.title: oil steady
text: oil prices are steady after positive data on us crude output overshadowed concerns about political instability in saudi arabia .
brent crude fell 0.1 % to $ 63.44 a barrel , while us oil rose 0.1 % to $ 56.84 .

brent hit $ 64.65 earlier this week - the highest for more than two years - as political tensions in the middle east escalated after a sweeping anti-corruption purge in saudi arabia , one of the world 's biggest oil exporters .

documents.title: weedkiller vote fails
text: european union states have failed in the latest bid to agree on a new five-year licence for the controversial weedkiller glyphosate , which critics believe causes cancer , ministers said .

`` no qualified majority for glyphosate renewal in vote today , '' luxembourg environment minister carole dieschbourg tweeted after the vote , which comes just weeks before the current licence expires on 15 december .
her belgian counterpart confirmed the result .

documents.title: eurozone growth up
text: business correspondent joe miller tweets :
euro area economy set to grow by 2.2 % this year - fastest pace for a decade .
crucial caveat in ec 's release : `` our projections for 2019 are based on a purely technical assumption of status quo in terms of trading relations between the eu27 and the uk . ''
worth noting that even with status quo , ec predicts uk gdp growth to slow to 1.1 % by 2019 .
euro area economy set to grow by 2.2 % this year - fastest pace for a decade .
crucial caveat in ec 's release : `` our projections for 2019 are based on a purely technical assumption of status quo in terms of trading relations between the eu27 and the uk . ''
worth noting that even with status quo , ec predicts uk gdp growth to slow to 1.1 % by 2019 .
euro area economy set to grow by 2.2 % this year - fastest pace for a decade .
crucial caveat in ec 's release : `` our projections for 2019 are based on a purely technical assumption of status quo in terms of trading relations between the eu27 and the uk . ''
worth noting that even with status quo , ec predicts uk gdp growth to slow to 1.1 % by 2019 .
if you believe that , you will believe in anything , including father christmas !
is n't this a bit like saying i am going to draw the lottery and win it tonight ?
who takes a forecast of the eu from the eu seriously ?

documents.title: new jaguars hit the road
text: jaguar land rover is ready to roll out new models next year , investing more than £ 4bn to extend the range and manufacturing capacity .
the tata-owned firm will build a new plant in slovakia and is also planning to launch a smaller , cheaper version of the jaguar e-pace suv in markets including china .
a refreshed range rover and range rover sport including hybrid models , as well as the jaguar i-pace electric performance suv , will also hit the roads .
tata motors said today that higher sales at jaguar land rover helped profits jump nearly three-fold for the quarter to 30 september .

documents.title: some relief for savers
text: news personal finance correspondent simon gompertz tweets :
national savings passes on interest rate rise : direct isa 0.75 % - > 1 % , premium bond average return up to 1.4 %

documents.title: retailers punish ftse
text: retailers are performing poorly on the ftse 100 , which erased earlier losses to be flat at 7,528 points .
luxury fashion house burberry ( which reported higher profits but announced a new strategy that has spooked investors , is down almost 10 % - making it the biggest faller .
marks & spencer shed 3.4 % after saying on wednesday it would open fewer simply food shops than expected .
meanwhile , sainsbury 's fell 3.1 % after reporting a 9 % decline in half-year profits .
the biggest gainers on the ftse 100 were informa , which rallied 2.6 % , and astrazeneca .

documents.title: halfords loses pressure
text: shares in halfords are down after the retailer said half-year profits were hit by higher costs linked following the slide in sterling .
the car parts , bicycles and camping chain said underlying pre-tax profit slipped 9.8 % to £ 36.8m in the six months to 29 september despite a 1.5 % rise in like-for-like sales .
shares fell more than 5 % to 314.8p in morning trading .
halfords said that while `` prolonged uncertainty '' over brexit , weak sterling and a slowing economy would hurt sales , it could also benefit from a rise in staycations .

documents.title: happy christmas
text: business correspondent emma simpson tweets :
customers will be able to collect argos goods from 400 sainsbury 's stores this christmas .
and he expects a fifth of christmas sales will be online .
listening to ceo mike coupe on sainsbury 's half year results .
says there 's plenty of momentum in the business and is confident about christmas .

documents.title: 'no pain , no gain '
text: while burberry 's results were `` strong '' , investors are focusing on new chief executive marco gobbetti 's announcement to push the brand `` ever deeper into luxury territory '' , says steve clayton of hargreaves lansdown .
this approach is not unique to burberry , but `` will take time and in the near term , sales growth will be held back and the group must invest more to achieve its goals '' , he comments .
investors are being asked to back mr gobbetti in a no pain , no gain '' strategy shift , mr clatyon said .

meanwhile , lee wild at interactive investor says there may be `` big benefits '' to trying to generate `` high-single digit revenue growth plus 'meaningful ' operating margin expansion '' , but they will not be seen until 2021 .

documents.title: tencent boosts hang seng
text: shares in hong kong moved higher on thursday , helped by surging gains for tencent , with the hang seng adding 0.8 % to close at 29,136.5 points .
yet it was a mixed session elsewhere in asia , with japan 's nikkei giving up early gains to close down 0.2 % at 22,868.7 points .
south korea 's kospi index slipped 0.1 % to end at 2,550.57 , while australia 's s & p/asx added 0.6 % to 6,049.4 points .

documents.title: emirates flying high
text: profits at emirates airlines more than doubled to 1.7bn dirhams ( £ 352m ) in the first half of 2017 , buoyed by positive currency movements .
revenues rose 6 % to 44.5bn .
about 29.2m passengers flew with the airline in the period - a 4 % increase .
the news comes amid reports that airbus is close to a $ 14bn ( £ 10.7bn ) deal to sell about 30 of its a380 planes to emirates .

documents.title: 'through the worst '
text: sainsbury 's has reported a 9 % fall in half-year profits , but the decline was not as bad as expected and sales rose .
chief executive mike coupe said the fall in profits was due to price cutting , higher wage costs and the consolidation of argos .
he tells bbc breakfast the supermarket is `` through the worst '' when it comes to inflationary pressure on food prices .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: jlr drives tata profits
text: higher sales at jaguar land rover has helped profits at tata motors soar nearly three-fold rise for the quarter to 30 september .
analysts had expected a net profit of about 15bn rupees , but the indian firm reported a profit of 24.8bn compared with 8.3bn rupees a year ago .
revenue for the quarter rose about 9 % to 701bn rupees .

documents.title: burberry aims high
text: more on burberry .
for those wondering what its plan to `` rationalise non-luxury wholesale and retail doors '' means , this is the translation .
it plans to go even further upmarket and is looking hard at where its clothes can be bought , with plans to pull its ranges from some department stores , as well as close some of its own outlets .
burberry is so image conscious it will not only look at whether it is in the right area , on the right street - but even check out whether it 's next to the right neighbours .
the company is growing apace - notching up double-digit sales growth , according to its latest results .
the company says outgoing chief executive christopher bailey was involved in forming the strategy .
it 's still a bit puzzling as to why the shares have tanked so much today , though .
author: Rebecca Marston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: volkswagen speeds ahead
text: volkswagen had a record october , delivering 550,900 vehicles worldwide - a 7.7 % increase year on year .
the german car maker was helped by stronger sales in china , south america and north america , as well as stable deliveries in europe .
the update may come as good news to investors concerned about volkswagen 's diesel emissions scandal , which has dented its profits .

documents.title: breakingburberry plunges
text: shares in burberry have fallen more than 11 % at the open , helping drag the ftse 100 0.3 % lower at 7,507 points .
the fall comes despite a 4 % rise in like-for-like sales to £ 1.26bn for the six months to september 30 .
the company will take a £ 15m restructuring hit linked to a new store closure programme .

documents.title: more women on boards
text: a government-backed review has found that ftse 100 firms are `` on course '' to meet a voluntary 33 % target for women on boards by 2020 .
however , smaller companies listed on the london stock exchange are lagging behind .
to hit the target , ftse 250 firms will need to fill at least 40 % of top jobs with women over the next three years .

denise wilson , chief executive of the hampton-alexander review 2017 , tells bbc radio 4 's today programme that the committee `` never thought this would be quick or easy , but we have seen huge change '' .
`` the supply of women is not the issue , '' she adds .
`` women getting appointed is the issue . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: burberry 's new direction
text: times retail editor deirdre hipwell tweets on burberry :
this is burberry 's new strategy will see if marco gobbetti puts more flesh on the bone on this new plan when , unlike his press-shy predecessor , christopher bailey , he speaks to the press later
yes , no , brilliant , very clear .
how smart of # burberry to hire a really cool pr agency .
burberry , like many luxury retailers , is a past master at management speak
evidently

documents.title: 'new energy ' for burberry
text: still in the world of fashion , the slightly more upmarket burberry plans to `` re-energise '' its apparel in a bid to expand its customer base .
the company said it will reshape its offerings , `` increasing and invigorating the fashion content '' with new luxury leather goods and accessories .
the brand will also `` convey a new energy '' as the firm plans to focus more on digital to tap into new audiences .
the update comes as burberry embarks on a cost-saving drive as it seeks to save at least £ 100m by 2019 .
pre-tax profits are up 26 % to £ 128m for the six months to september , with a 9 % rise in revenues to £ 1.26bn .

documents.title: 'relentless ' supergroup
text: superdry owner supergroup says in a trading statement that `` global brand revenue '' has jumped 25 % to £ 756.3m for the six months to october .
more interesting is the section in the statement headlined `` relentless innovation '' :
`` innovation continued in both mainline and development areas .

within the core mainline , authority within jackets was strengthened by the launch of the first of a series of responsibly sourced down jackets , which will meet the highest ethical standards , containing only ethically sourced down .

the college-inspired varsity range , targeted at younger customers , pairing on-trend badging with superdry 's renowned graphic handwriting in a traditional colour palette of red , white and blue , was also highly successful . ''
there you have it .
by the way , supergroup shares have risen 230 % since it listed back in 2010 , making the company worth a tidy £ 1.5bn .

documents.title: flybe hits more turbulence
text: regional airline flybe has reported a 47 % drop in adjusted pre-tax profit to £ 8.4m .
the firm attributed the decrease to a `` previously announced one-off onerous it contract provision and the impact of increased aircraft maintenance costs '' , as well as the drop in sterling .
flybe has struggled with a series of costly mistakes , including running too many loss-making routes and failed joint ventures .
in june , it promised to reduce the size of its fleet after it saw slowing growth in demand .

`` our strategy remains on track to reduce our fleet size to an optimum level for the number of identified profitable routes and make the business demand-driven rather than capacity-led '' , the company said in a trading update .

documents.title: very convenient
text: bryan roberts at tcc global has been looking at the sainsbury 's results too :
sainsbury 's says online grocery up 7.2 % , convenience up 8.2 % & clothing up 6.8 %
lfl or total sales ?
total
clothing is mostly due to my wife .
ca n't move in our house for tu ; )

documents.title: christmas not cancelled
text: more from mike coupe : he tells today the grocery market is very competitive , but is pleased with the performance and `` positive momentum '' as the supermarket is serving a record numbers of customers .
consumers have largely been insulated from food price inflation - and prices will be about the same as christmas two years ago .
`` christmas is not cancelled this year , '' mr coupe says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'positive momentum '
text: mike coupe , chief executive of sainsbury , says the company has delivered a good performance in the past six months .
`` we are adapting to meet customers ' changing shopping habits and , as a result , we are seeing positive momentum across the business .

this half we have updated and improved 70 of our food ranges , covering around 40 % of our food sales ; improved our offer across 15 % of our supermarket space and opened a further 73 argos stores in sainsbury 's , giving customers more reasons to shop at sainsbury 's .
we continue to focus on offering our customers great value , supported by our removal of multibuys . ''

documents.title: breakingsainsbury 's profits sag
text: sainsbury 's half-year profits have fallen 9 % to £ 251m for the 28 weeks to 23 september , despite a 1.6 % rise in like-for-like sales excluding fuel .

documents.title: adidas winning
text: adidas has reported another strong quarter of sales and profit growth , driven by expansion in china and north america , where it has been winning market share from nike .
the german firm said third-quarter sales rose 9 % to €5.67bn , while net profit jumped more than a third to €526m - although both figures were slightly lower than analysts had expected .

documents.title: christmas the 'real test ' for sainsbury 's
text: while all eyes are on sainsbury 's results this morning , the true test for the supermarkets chain will be the christmas season , says laura foll , a fund manager at janus henderson investors .
`` it will be hugely important to see how well they 've integrated home retail , '' she tells bbc radio 4 's today programme referring to the former owner of catalogue retailer argos .
sainsbury 's said earlier this year it plans to open 250 argos outlets in its stores as it takes on low-cost rivals and amazon .
`` if you look at things like brc retail sales data , it 's still a very tough environment , '' ms foll said .
`` it will be a real test whether they sell well over christmas . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: siemens profits jump
text: siemens , the german industrial group that makes everything from trains and wind turbines to mri scanners , has reported an 11 % rise in annual net profit to €6bn , meeting its own forecasts .
however , quarterly profits at its power and gas unit - the company 's second-biggest after healthcare - plunged 40 % to €303m .
siemens is about to revamp the unit as part of a wider ongoing restructuring .
chief executive joe kaeser says : `` there is a lot of work ahead of us . ''

documents.title: self-driving shuttle bus crashes
text: a self-driving shuttle bus in las vegas has collided with a slow-moving lorry on its first day of service .
nobody was injured in the incident , which city officials say was the fault of the lorry driver , who was fined by police .
the shuttle is the first of its kind to be used on public roads in the us .
the collision comes a day after waymo - owned by google 's parent company alphabet - said it is launching a fully self-driving fleet of taxis in phoenix , arizona .
read more here .
author: Dave Lee
North America technology reporter

documents.title: trump : 'i do n't blame china '
text: president trump is in china today and bbc news north america correspondent aleem maqbool tweets :
the stand out remark of trump 's statement to chinese business leaders re the trade imbalance he 's talked so much about `` i do n't blame china .
who can blame a country for being able to take advantage of another country for benefit if their citizens ?
i give china great credit ''
speaking in beijing , trump details all the ways the us is 'losing ' in trade with china .
but , once again , he criticises previous us administrations , not china
after all the tough talk in the past , now in beijing , trump has directed more digs at former us presidents than at china 's actions .

documents.title: scott cuts spacey
text: more bad news for kevin spacey today : he is being cut from ridley scott 's thriller all the money in the world , even though it is due to be released in just over a month .
replacing the actor , who faces a number of allegations of sexual misconduct , after the film has been finished is unprecedented for hollywood .
scott has chosen to remove spacey , who appeared in a number of scenes portraying oil mogul jean paul getty , and replace him with christopher plummer , according to the hollywood reporter .
reshooting spacey 's scenes with plummer and replacing them will be a significant challenge for the director and his team , however .

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to another day of business live .
main event this morning is the half-year results from sainsbury 's - and profits are expected to be lower than last year .
the supermarket is the uk 's second-biggest grocery retailer with about 16 % of the market .
today 's fun grocery fact : sainsbury 's has 24 million customer transactions a week at its 1,200 stores and the company employs 161,000 people .
that and much more - thanks for joining us .
get in touch as always at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk or follow me on twitter : @ twitterid
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News
